intro: Involucraria modecca, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive seed pods that enclose numerous small, round seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both wet and dry conditions. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus.
